gurmukhi: ਕੲੀ ਤੀਰਥ ਤੀਰਥ ਭਰਮਤ ਸੁ ਭਰਮ ॥ ਕੲੀ ਅਗਨ ਹੋਤ੍ਰ ਕੲੀ ਦੇਵ ਕਰਮ ॥
transliteration: Kaee Teerath Teerath Bharmat Su Bharam|| Kaee Agad Hotra Kaee Dev Karam||
translation: Many wander away on various pilgrim-stations, in delusion. Some perform havens and some perform rituals to please gods.

gurmukhi: ਕੲੀ ਕਰਤ ਬੀਰ ਬਿਦਿਅਾ ਬਿਚਾਰ ॥ ਨਹੀਂ ਤਦਪ ਤਾਸ ਪਾਯਤ ਨ ਪਾਰ ॥੧੪॥੧੩੪॥
transliteration: Kaee Karat Hoor Bidiaa Bichaar|| Nahoon Tadap Taas Paayat Na Paar||14||134||
translation: Some pay consideration to the learning of warfare. Still they cannot comprehend of the Lord.14.134.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਰਾਜ ਰੀਤ ਕਹੂੰ ਜੋਗ ਧਰਮ ॥ ਕੲੀ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ੳੁਚਰਤ ਸੁ ਕਰਮ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Raaj Root Kahoon Jog Dharam|| Kaee Sinmrit(i) Saastra Ouchrat Su Karam||
translation: Somewhere royal discipline is being followed and somewhere the discipline of Yoga. Many perform the recitation of Smritis and Shastras.

gurmukhi: ਨਿੳੁਲੀ ਅਾਦਿ ਕਰਮ ਕਹੂੰ ਹਸਤ ਦਾਨ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਅਸ੍ਵਮੇਧ ਮਖ ਕੋ ਬਖਾਨ ॥੧੫॥੧੩੫॥
transliteration: Nioloo Aadh Karam Kdhoondhasat Daan|| Kahoon Asvamedh Makh Ko Bakhaan||15||135||
translation: Somewhere Yogic Karmas including neoli (purgation of intestines) are being practiced and somewhere elephants are being given as gifts. Somewhere the horse sacrifices are being performed and their merits are being related.15.135.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਕਰਤ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬਿਦਿਅਾ ਬਿਚਾਰ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਜੋਗ ਰੀਤ ਕਹੂੰ ਬ੍ਰਿੱਧ ਚਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Karat Brahm Bidiaa Bichaar|| Kahoon Jog Root Kahoon Briddh Chaar||
translation: Somewhere the Brahmins are holding discussions about Theology. Somewhere the Yogic methods are being practiced and somewhere the four stages of life are being followed.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਕਰਤ ਜੱਛ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬ ਗਾਨ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਧੂਪ ਦੀਪ ਕਹੂੰ ਅਰਘ ਦਾਨ ॥੧੬॥੧੩੬॥
transliteration: Kahoon Karat Jachchh Gaddhrab Gadn|| Kahoon Dhoop Doop Kahoon Argh Daan||16||136||
translation: Somewhere the Yaksha and Gandharvas sing. Somewhere the offerings of incense, earthen lamps and libations are made. 16.136.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਪਿਤ੍ਰ ਕਰਮ ਕਹੂੰ ਬੇਦ ਰੀਤ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਨ੍ਰਿਤ ਨਾਚ ਕਹੂੰ ਗਾਨ ਗੀਤ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Pitra Karam Kahoon Bed Root|| Kahoon Nrit Naach Kahoon Gadn Goot||
translation: Somewhere karmas are performed for the manes and somewhere the Vedic injunctions are followed. Somewhere the dances are accomplished and somewhere songs are sung.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਕਰਤ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਿ ੳੁਚਾਰ ॥ ਕੲੀ ਭਜਤ ੲੇਕ ਪਗ ਨਿਰਾਧਾਰ ॥੧੭॥੧੩੭॥
transliteration: Kahoon Karat Saastra Sinmrit(i) Ouchaar|| Kaee Bahajat Ek Pag Niraadhaar||17||137||
translation: Somewhere the Shastras and Smritis are recited. May pray stading on a single foot. 17.137.

gurmukhi: ਕੲੀ ਨੇਹ ਦੇਹ ਕੲੀ ਗੇਹ ਵਾਸ ॥ ਕੲੀ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਦੇਸ ਦੇਸਨ ੳੁਦਾਸ ॥
transliteration: Kaee Neh Deh Kaee Geh Vaas|| Kaee Bhramat Des Desan Udaas||
translation: Many are attached to their bodies and many reside in their homes. Many wander in various countries as hermits.

gurmukhi: ਕੲੀ ਜਲ ਨਿਵਾਸ ਕਦੀ ਅਗਨਿ ਤਾਪ ॥ ਕੲੀ ਜਪਤ ੳੁਰਧ ਲਟਕੰਤ ਜਾਪ ॥੧੮॥੧੩੮॥
transliteration: Kaee Jal Nivaas Kaee Agad(i) Taap|| Kaee Japat Uradh Latkant Jaap||18||138||
translation: Many live in water and many endure the heat of fire. Many worship the Lord with face upside down. 18.138.

gurmukhi: ਕੲੀ ਕਰਤ ਜੋਗ ਕਲਪੰ ਪ੍ਰਜੰਤ ॥ ਨਹੀ ਤਦਪਿ ਤਾਸ ਪਾਯਤ ਨ ਅੰਤ ॥
transliteration: Kaee Karat Jog Kalpan Prajant|| Nahoo Tadap(i) Taas Paayat Na Ant||
translation: Many practice Yoga for various kalpas (ages). Still they cannot know the Lord’s end.

gurmukhi: ਕੲੀ ਕਰਤ ਕੋਟ ਬਿੱਦਿਅਾ ਬਿਚਾਰ ॥ ਨਹੀ ਤਦਪਿ ਦਿਸਟਿ ਦੇਖੈ ਮੁਰਾਰ ॥੧੯॥੧੩੯॥
transliteration: Kaee Karat Kot Biddiaa Bichaar|| Nahoo Tadap(i) Disttee Dekhai Muraar||19||139||
translation: Many a million indulge in the study of sciences. Still they cannot behold the Sight of the Lord.19.139.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ਭਗਤਿ ਸਕਤਿ ਨਹੀ ਪਰਤ ਪਾਨ ॥ ਬਹੁ ਕਰਤ ਹੋਮ ਅਰ ਜੱਗ ਦਾਨ ॥
transliteration: Bin Bhagad(i) Sakat(i) Nahoo Parat Paan|| Bahu Karat Ho Mar Jagg Daan||
translation: Without the power of devotion they cannot realise the Lord. Though they perform havens, hold Yagyas (sacrifices) and offer charities.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਨਾਮ ੲਿਕ ਚਿੱਤ ਲੀਨ ॥ ਫੋਕਟੋ ਸਰਬ ਧਰਮਾ ਬਿਹੀਨ ॥੨੦॥੧੪੦॥
transliteration: Bin Ek Naam Ik Chitt Loon|| Phokato Sarab Dharmaa Bihoon||20||140||
translation: Without the single-minded absorption in he Lord’s Name, All the religious rituals are useless. 20.140.
